definitions.body: coll. tears (chiefly poet. and late; freq. in Je. and contemp.) (Ar. dam9un; As. dimu, dimtu Hpt:KAT 2 Gloss i. Zim:BP 23, 95; Aram. [[דִּמְעָא]], dem9o0; NH [[דֶּמַע]], [[דִּמְעָה]])—abs. ´[[ד]] Ps 80:6 + 10 t.; cstr. [[דִּמְעַת]] Ec 4:l; sf. [[דִּמְעָתִי]] Ps 6:7 + 4 t.; [[דִּמְעָתֶָךָ]] 2Ki 20:5 = Is 38:5 + Ez Eze 24:16 (del. LXX Co); [[דִּמְעָתָהּ]] La 1:2; pl. [[דְּמָעוֹת]] Ps 80:6, La 2:11—tears Ps 6:7, Ec 4:1, La 1:2, La 2:11; esp. in Je. in phrase [[תֵּרֵד]] ´[[עֵינִי ד]] etc. Je 9:17, Je 13:17, Je 14:17, cf. La 2:18; Je 8:23 [[וְעֵינִי]] ´[[מְקוֹר ד]]; [[אֲרַיׇּ֫וֶךְ דִּמְעָתִי]] of weeping over, in behalf of one Is 16:9; as appealing to God's compassion 2Ki 20:5 = Is 38:5 Ps 39:13; Ps 56:9 ´[[שִׂימָה ד]] [[בְּנאׁדֶָךָ]] (cf. Che); v. also Ps 116:8, Je 31:16, Is 25:8; opp. [[רִנׇּה]] Ps 126:5; of hypocritical tears Mal 2:13; fig. tears as food Ps 42:4 ([[דִּמְעָתִי לחם]]); ´[[לחם ד]] Ps 80:6; as drink Ps 80:6, cf. Babyl. dimtu maštîtî, tears (were) my drink (Zim:BP 42; ‖ bikîtum kurmatî, weeping (was) my sustenance).—Ez Eze 24:16 [[וְלאׁ]] [[תָבוֹא דִּמְעָתֶָךָ]] del. LXX Co cf. v:Eze 24:23.
